name: Sweet Basil
climate: Sweet Basil thrives in warm climates with temperatures between 70-90Â°F. Avoid frost as it can damage the plant.
This plant prefers subtropical regions and grows best in well-drained, fertile soils with high sun exposure.
It can be grown in cooler climates but will require protection during cold months to ensure survival.
Humidity is beneficial, so environments with moderate to high humidity levels can enhance growth rates.
sunlight: Sweet Basil requires full sun exposure for at least 6-8 hours a day to grow optimally.
Ensure that the plant is placed in a location where it receives unobstructed sunlight for most of the day.
Partial shade might be tolerated but can result in slower growth and less aromatic leaves.
If grown indoors, placing the basil near a south-facing window is ideal for sufficient light.
watering: Basil needs regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
In hotter climates, increase watering frequency to prevent the plant from drying out.
During cooler months, reduce the frequency of watering to avoid root rot.
It is ideal to water in the early morning to allow the foliage to dry by nightfall.
soil: Sweet Basil thrives in rich, well-drained soil that retains moisture without becoming soggy.
Loamy soil that is enhanced with organic compost can significantly boost plant growth.
Ensure the soil has good aeration properties to allow roots to receive ample oxygen.
A neutral pH balance is ideal, though slightly acidic conditions can also support growth.
extra_care_tip: Pinch off the flower heads as they appear to encourage leaf growth and prolong harvest.
